title: GRAPH Explain how parties will respond to the data

content.description:
Population by Race and Ethnicity

Source: United States Census Bureau, 2012
content.question: Which of the following best explains how political parties are likely to respond to the data in the chart?

choices.label: Political parties are likely to continue to stand by their traditional positions and not bother to appeal to groups that have not previously been included in their base.
Political parties will adapt their positions and find ways to appeal to voters from growing demographic groups.
Political parties will adapt by switching from candidate-centered campaigns to campaigns that strategically mobilize voters across the country with a consistent message.
Political parties will advocate for proportional representational systems so that groups with larger populations are able to win seats and be represented more fairly in government.

content.answer: Political parties will adapt their positions and find ways to appeal to voters from growing demographic groups.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain what the data implies or illustrates about political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
